abstract: Zappos.com initially didn’t want to sell itself to Amazon.com last year, but pressures from backer Sequoia Capital forced the shoe retailer’s hand, its chief executive writes at Inc.
snippet: Zappos.com initially didn’t want to sell itself to Amazon.com last year, but pressures from backer Sequoia Capital forced the shoe retailer’s hand, its chief executive writes at Inc.
lead_paragraph: 5:03 p.m. | Updated At the time that Zappos.com announced its sale to Amazon.com last year, several reports said that the shoe retailer’s management — specifically its chief executive, Tony Hsieh — did not want to sell.

headline.main: Tensions Simmered in Zappos Sale to Amazon

abstract: Apple’s advances in the e-book market are not as impressive as they sound, but could prove trouble for Amazon down the road.
snippet: Apple’s advances in the e-book market are not as impressive as they sound, but could prove trouble for Amazon down the road.
lead_paragraph: There was e-book news on Monday at Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference: Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s chief executive, said that big publishers had told him that sales of e-books for the iPad now accounted for 22 percent of all e-book sales.

headline.main: Why Apple’s iBooks Numbers Are Meaningless
